required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Beetroot Juice Supplements on Lower-limb Strength in Females
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Effects of Beetroot Juice Supplements on Lower-limb Strength and Muscular Endurance in Physically Active Women: Double-blind Crossover Randomized Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Maimónides Biomedical Research Institute of Córdoba

clinical_study.source: Maimónides Biomedical Research Institute of Córdoba

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the effects of beetroot juice supplements on lower-limb strength and muscular endurance in physically active women, due to the presence of NO3- in beetroot juice.

detailed_description.textblock:
Beetroot juice (BJR) is used as an ergogenic aid, but no study has analyzed its' effects on explosive force production in physically active women. It has been proposed that females could blunt reduction of NO2- to NO based on a higher oxidative skeletal muscle phenotype than males. However, it has been observed a higher increase on plasma NO2- levels after supplementation compared to and a greater enhancement on muscle contractile function.
Based on the absence of any study that has analyzed the effect of NO3- supplements on jump ability and power production on weightlifting on female population; the purpose of this study will be to investigate the possible ergogenic effect of BJR on physically active women on explosive force production and muscular endurance in a lower-limb body weightlifting protocol, due to the presence of NO3- in BJR and its effects.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The experimental procedure will consist of three visits, separate from each other by one week, to achieve the total elimination of any effects caused by BJR as well as the optimal recovery of the participants.
study_design_info.masking_description: The order in which the participants will consume one supplement or another will be assigned randomly and double blind by an external collaborator to the research team, who will be responsible for coding the bottles.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of height reached in jump
primary_outcome.description: Evaluated through CMJ (Counter movement jump) test with a recovery period of 45 seconds between jumps.

secondary_outcome.description: The test consists of three exercises: back squat, leg press and leg extension. Three series will be performed until concentric failure at 75% RM, three minutes of rest between each series.
Immediately at the end of the muscular endurance test, participants will be instructed to report their RPE using a scale 1-10 (worse to better outcome).

arm_group.description: 70 mL of beetroot juice (BEET It Sport®; James White Drinks Ltd., Ipswich, UK)

intervention.description: Subjects will drink juice 120 minutes before each visit
70 mL of blackcurrant beverage, which is depleted of NO3- will be taken 120 min before each visit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Physically active females with 18-30 years of age
- More than 6 months on RT training programs
- Be familiarized with back squat, leg press and leg extension exercises
- Not consuming any type of nutritional supplement or anabolic substances in the previous three months or during the study
- Not suffering from a musculoskeletal injury that could interfere with the exercise protocol during the investigation
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

facility.name: Studies Research Group in Neuromuscular Responses (GEPREN), University of Lavras

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be shared after the study concludes and results are published
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Upon request to study's principal investigator
